column4: heya, I'm trying to wipe a disk form a live ubuntu...but using dd from /dev/zero and/or dev/urandom is just soooo slooowwwwww. Is there any way to monitor th eprogress of a ATA secure erase? or estimate beforehand how long it will take?
? I want to wipe the disk,not find bad sectors
overwrites the drive with 0x00 and verifies if the write was correct
so, wouldn't that be even slower? I have several disks to wipe, and waiting days to wipe just the smallest one seems kinda lengthy
still, I'm looking at weeks of wipe time here
you can also use different block sized for dd..
as writing 512byte sectors it usually requires 15 reads and 16 writes to overwrite a 4k block hdd
you need to specify to dd what size blocks to write
or check what the optimal block size is
yeah I tried a few and 4K seesm to be faster
although there isnt much fo a difference between 4K and 32M...
yeah, /dev/null finishes in less than a second ;)
there a no mythical methods for extracting data from hdd once everything has been overwritten..
unless of course during the lifespan of the hdd it has had many sector reallocations..
well I gather that those 4k could not statistacally contain such important data that you would like to destroy the whole hdd
